words.definition: An official document issued by a government, certifying the holder's identity and citizenship and entitling them to travel under its protection to and from foreign countries.
words.example_sentence: Don't forget your passport when traveling internationally.

words.definition: A pass that allows you to board a ship or plane.
words.example_sentence: Please have your boarding pass ready at the gate.

words.definition: The act of reporting one's arrival (at a hotel, airport, etc.).
words.example_sentence: We need to check in at the airport two hours before the flight.

words.definition: An inspection or evaluation performed to determine compliance with security requirements.
words.example_sentence: All passengers must go through a security check before boarding.

words.definition: An arrangement to have something (as a hotel room or a table in a restaurant) held for one's use at a later time.
words.example_sentence: Do you have a reservation for tonight?

words.definition: The area in a hotel or office building where guests or visitors are greeted.
words.example_sentence: Ask at the reception desk for your room key.

words.definition: The time by which a hotel guest must vacate their room.
words.example_sentence: Check-out time at the hotel is 11 AM.

words.definition: An object or feature of a landscape or town that is easily seen and recognized.
words.example_sentence: The Eiffel Tower is a famous landmark in Paris.

words.definition: A person who is traveling or visiting a place for pleasure or interest.
words.example_sentence: Many tourists visit Antalya each year.

words.definition: A place or feature that draws visitors by providing something of interest or pleasure.
words.example_sentence: The museum is the city's main tourist attraction.

words.definition: The activity of visiting interesting places, especially by tourists.
words.example_sentence: We spent the whole day sightseeing in Rome.

words.definition: Instructions about how to get from one place to another.
words.example_sentence: Can you give me directions to the nearest train station?

words.definition: A diagrammatic representation of an area of land or sea showing physical features, cities, roads, etc.
words.example_sentence: We used a map to find our way around the city.

words.definition: A thing that is kept as a reminder of a person, place, or event.
words.example_sentence: I bought a small souvenir from my trip to London.

words.definition: A thing bought or offered for sale much more cheaply than is usual or expected.
words.example_sentence: This dress was a real bargain.

words.definition: A place where goods are bought and sold, typically an open-air area or a covered building.
words.example_sentence: We bought fresh fruit at the local market.

words.definition: The process of converting one currency into another.
words.example_sentence: I need to find a currency exchange office.

words.definition: A period of rest or waiting before a further stage in a journey.
words.example_sentence: We had a long layover in Dubai on our way to Australia.

words.definition: The official department that administers and collects the duties levied on imported goods.
words.example_sentence: We had to declare everything at customs.

words.definition: A feeling of tiredness and confusion experienced by travelers by plane to a different time zone.
words.example_sentence: I'm still suffering from jet lag after my flight from New York.

questions.text: The feeling of tiredness and confusion after a long flight across time zones is called:
questions.explanation: Jet lag is specifically related to time zone changes during air travel.

words.definition: A person with whom one works, especially in a profession or business.
words.example_sentence: She introduced me to her new colleague at the meeting.

words.definition: The combined action of a group of people, especially when effective and efficient.
words.example_sentence: Effective teamwork is crucial for project success.

words.definition: The action of promoting or being promoted to a higher rank or position.
words.example_sentence: He received a promotion after five years of hard work.

words.definition: A brief account of one's professional or work experience and qualifications, often submitted with a job application.
words.example_sentence: Don't forget to attach your resume to the email.

words.definition: A formal meeting at which a person is questioned to discover whether they are suitable for a job or a course of study.
words.example_sentence: She has a job interview tomorrow morning.

words.definition: A fixed regular payment, typically paid on a monthly or biweekly basis but often expressed as an annual sum, made by an employer to an employee, especially a professional or white-collar worker.
words.example_sentence: His new job offers a good salary and benefits.

words.definition: The amount of work that a person or organization has to do.
words.example_sentence: I have a heavy workload this week due to the new project.

words.definition: A person's range of abilities or qualities.
words.example_sentence: Her diverse skill set makes her a valuable asset to the company.

words.definition: The action or process of interacting with others to exchange information and develop professional or social contacts.
words.example_sentence: Networking is important for career advancement.

words.definition: Time spent working in addition to one's regular working hours.
words.example_sentence: He worked overtime to finish the report before the deadline.

words.definition: A person or organization using the services of a lawyer or other professional person or company.
words.example_sentence: We are meeting with a new client this afternoon.

words.definition: A planned piece of work that has a specific purpose and that usually requires a lot of time.
words.example_sentence: The team is working on a new software project.

words.definition: An assembly of people for a particular purpose, especially for formal discussion.
words.example_sentence: We have a team meeting every Monday morning.

words.definition: A formal talk by a person or a group, typically with a visual aid, to an audience.
words.example_sentence: She gave an excellent presentation on the company's new strategy.

words.definition: Information about reactions to a product, a person's performance of a task, etc., used as a basis for improvement.
words.example_sentence: We received positive feedback from our customers.

words.definition: Discussion aimed at reaching an agreement.
words.example_sentence: The negotiation for the new contract took several weeks.

words.definition: The action or process of innovating.
words.example_sentence: The company is known for its constant innovation.

words.definition: The state or quality of producing something, especially crops.
words.example_sentence: New software improved our team's productivity.

words.definition: The amount of time you spend doing your job compared with the amount of time you spend with your family and doing things you enjoy.
words.example_sentence: Achieving a good work-life balance is important for well-being.

words.definition: A working arrangement in which employees do not commute to a central place of work.
words.example_sentence: Remote work has become more common since the pandemic.

questions.text: Which word describes working additional hours beyond regular ones?
Discussion aimed at reaching an agreement is called:
questions.explanation: Negotiation is a formal discussion to reach an agreement.

words.definition: A style or method of cooking, especially as characteristic of a particular country, region, or establishment.
words.example_sentence: French cuisine is famous worldwide.

words.definition: A set of instructions for preparing a particular dish, including a list of the ingredients required.
words.example_sentence: Can you share your cake recipe?

words.definition: Any of the foods or substances that are combined to make a particular dish.
words.example_sentence: I have all the ingredients for the soup.

words.definition: Cook (food) by dry heat without direct exposure to a flame, typically in an oven or on a hot surface.
words.example_sentence: She loves to bake bread on weekends.

words.definition: (Of a liquid) reach or cause to reach the temperature at which it bubbles and turns to vapor.
words.example_sentence: Please boil some water for pasta.

words.definition: Cook (food) in hot fat or oil.
words.example_sentence: Let's fry some eggs for breakfast.

words.definition: Cook (food) using a grill.
words.example_sentence: We'll grill some chicken for dinner.

words.definition: Cook (food, especially meat or vegetables) by prolonged exposure to heat in an oven or over a fire.
words.example_sentence: She decided to roast a whole chicken.

words.definition: Cut (something) into small pieces.
words.example_sentence: Chop the onions finely.

words.definition: Cut (something) into thin pieces.
words.example_sentence: Slice the tomatoes for the salad.

words.definition: Remove the outer covering or skin from (a fruit, vegetable, or shrimp).
words.example_sentence: Don't forget to peel the potatoes before cooking.

words.definition: The sensation of flavor perceived in the mouth and throat on contact with a substance.
words.example_sentence: This soup tastes delicious!

words.definition: Present (food or drink) to someone.
words.example_sentence: Dinner is ready to serve.

words.definition: The sweet course eaten at the end of a meal.
words.example_sentence: What's for dessert tonight?

words.definition: A small dish of food or a drink taken before a meal or the main course of a meal to stimulate one's appetite.
words.example_sentence: We ordered some spring rolls as an appetizer.

words.definition: The principal dish of a meal.
words.example_sentence: For the main course, I'll have the steak.

words.definition: A tool, container, or other article, especially for household use.
words.example_sentence: She sharpened all her kitchen utensils.

words.definition: To eat dinner in a restaurant.
words.example_sentence: We often dine out on weekends.

words.definition: Food that has not been eaten at the end of a meal and that is often eaten later.
words.example_sentence: I'll have the leftovers for lunch tomorrow.

words.definition: An aromatic or pungent vegetable substance used to flavor food, e.g., cloves, pepper, or cumin.
words.example_sentence: This dish needs more spice.

questions.text: Which word describes cutting something into small pieces?
The sweet course eaten at the end of a meal is called:
questions.explanation: Dessert is the sweet course served at the end of a meal.
